E

EmptyTile - Class in com.chess.board
EmptyTile is a child class of the Tile class Its purpose is to create an empty tile or a tile without a piece on it The methods in this class are: isTileOccupied() and getPiece() both of which is @Override from the parent class
EmptyTile(int) - Constructor for class com.chess.board.EmptyTile
 
equals(Object) - Method in class com.chess.board.Move.CaptureMove
As stated before, we want an Object equality rather than reference equality so we override the java.lang method to achieve our need
equals(Object) - Method in class com.chess.board.Move
Override the equals() of java.lang because java.lang equals() tests the reference equality.
equals(Object) - Method in class com.chess.board.Move.KingSideCastleMove
As stated before we want Object equality rather than reference equality which is the default for java.lang so we override the equals() method to suit our needs

As stated previously we want Object equality rather than Reference equality which is the default for the java.lang so we override this method to fit with our need

execute() - Method in class com.chess.board.Move
execute() is a method that executes the move and returns a new board with the changed game state made by the move
execute() - Method in class com.chess.board.Move.NullMove
Overrides the execute() method from the parent class because a null move should not be executed that is why it throws a RunTimeException
execute() - Method in class com.chess.board.Move.PawnEnPassantMove
execute() method here is an override of the execute method in the Move class It builds a new board that captures the enPassantPawn and sets the new position of the pawn on the board
execute() - Method in class com.chess.board.Move.PawnJump
execute() method is an override method from the parent class to create a new board to show the new state of the board and the difference here is that it sets the enPassantPawn as the pawn that has been moved
execute() - Method in class com.chess.board.Move.PawnPromotion
execute() method is an override method from the parent class to create a new board to show the new state of the board and the difference here is that instead of a pawn in the promotion squares a selected major piece is found on the tile where the pawn should be.
execute(Board) - Method in class com.chess.player.chessEngine.MiniMax
Overrides the execute method from MoveStrategy() to find the best move given the current state of the board
execute(Board) - Method in interface com.chess.player.chessEngine.MoveStrategy
